repnme.cdata!:
Lesotho - Private Sector Competitiveness
            and Economic Diversification Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Private Sector
            Competitiveness and Economic Diversification Project for
            Lesotho were as follows: outcomes were moderately
            satisfactory, risk to development outcome was moderate, Bank
            performance was moderately satisfactory, and Borrower
            performance was moderately satisfactory. Some lessons
            learned included: tree crop growing was new to not only most
            of Basotho farmers but also local agriculture administration
            officials. The government counterpart and the implementing
            agencies also need inputs and guidance on what should be
            changed to achieve the reform objectives and how to achieve
            them. A project aiming to achieve sector-wide targets should
            plan and budget for the strengthening of data management
            capacity at the government agencies and or public sector
            institutions as they are usually the authorities for
            collecting and publishing macroeconomic and sectoral data.

16907922.majtheme: Trade and integration,Financial and private sector development

repnme.cdata!:
Lesotho - Private Sector Competitiveness
            and Economic Diversification Project : environmental assessment

abstracts.cdata!:
Over the long term, objective of the
            Private Sector Competitiveness and Economic Diversification
            Project in Lesotho is to add more value to horticultural
            products grown in Lesotho, particularly vegetables, and
            fruit crops such as apples and cherries. Lesotho has faced
            land degradation and environmental crises of massive
            proportions for some time. Extreme care has to be taken to
            avoid the negative impacts that may accompany the
            implementation of the Project. The potential use of
            agrochemicals, in particular pesticides, under the
            prevailing poor management and weak regulatory environment,
            is fraught with serious environmental including human health
            dangers. Likewise, use of fertilizers, in particular
            nitrogenous, under poor field management, entails
            potentially serious issues of soil and water contamination,
            primarily through leaching and runoff. Careful attention
            must be paid to nitrogenous forms. Use of agricultural best
            management practices should be encouraged through their use,
            field demonstration, and farmers training to mitigate
            negative aspects of the project.

repnme.cdata!:
Lesotho - Private Sector Competitiveness
            and Economic Diversification Project : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Private Sector
            Competitiveness and Economic Diversification Project for
            Lesotho is to facilitate increased private sector investment
            by improving the business environment and diversifying
            sources of growth. The reallocation is necessary to support
            the implementation of the horticulture rollout scheme and
            the Public Private Partnership (PPP) transactions for the
            two skills centers. It is expected that the horticulture
            village rollout scheme will require procurement of goods
            such as netting and irrigation materials. Depending on the
            negotiation with potential private investors, goods may also
            need to be procured to support the PPP transaction for the
            two skill centers. The reallocation becomes necessary after
            a change of procurement plan and re-estimation of the amount
            of funds required to finance goods procurement.

display_title.display_title:
Lesotho - Private Sector
            Competitiveness and Economic Diversification Project :
            restructuring : Main report
